messages.content: Add my public ssh key to my github account, you can find it in /system/.ssh.

<function_thought>
The user wants to add their public SSH key to their GitHub account. I need to first read the SSH key from the specified path and then use the `git_add_ssh_key` tool to add it to the GitHub account. The path to the SSH key is `/system/.ssh`. I will need to list the directory to find the exact filename of the public SSH key.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[list_directory(path='/system/.ssh')]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>

[{'name': 'id_rsa', 'type': 'file', 'permissions': {'read': True, 'write': False, 'execute': False}}, {'name': 'id_rsa.pub', 'type': 'file', 'permissions': {'read': True, 'write': True, 'execute': False}}]

<function_thought>
The user wants to add their public SSH key to their GitHub account. The path to the public SSH key is `/system/.ssh/id_rsa.pub`. I need to read the content of this file and then use the `git_add_ssh_key` tool to add it.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[read_file(path='/system/.ssh/id_rsa.pub')]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>

<function_thought>
I have successfully read the public SSH key from `/system/.ssh/id_rsa.pub`. Now I need to add this key to the GitHub account using the `git_add_ssh_key` tool.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[git_add_ssh_key(ssh_key='ssh-rsa AAAAB3NzaC1yc2EAAAABIwAAAQEAr')]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>
